item.title: [474] This item is not in our database
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Mine does, I must have done it myself. ;p

anyway, change the capacity of definitions

I’m actually going off of the top of my head, but I believe the RAF reads a count integer when it begins parsing the item definitions from the file, you may have to change that. I can write up a basic item def editor for hyperion later if you want.

item.title: [474] This item is not in our database
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

forId(int) has a bounds check before the item is returned

    /**
     * Gets a definition for the specified id.
     *
     * @param id The id.
     * @return The definition.
     */
    public static ItemDefinition forId(int id) {
        return definitions[id];
    }

DOesn’t seem like it.

item.title: [474] This item is not in our database
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

I was wanting to spawn void in RS2-Server, but when I used the item command, a message appeared saying, “This item is not in our database.” I tried adding it to the binary file, but that gave me an ArrayExceptionError.

I also then tried spawning item 11730 (Saradomin Sword), and that did work also.

Thanks in help,
Arham

P.S: The item command:

                    if (BoundaryManager.isWithinBoundaryNoZ(player.getLocation(), "PvP Zone")) {
                        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You can't do that in a PvP Zone.");
                        return;
                    }
                    if (args.length == 2 || args.length == 3) {
                        int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                        if (ItemDefinition.forId(id) == null) {
                            player.getActionSender().sendMessage("That item is currently not in our database.");
                            return;
                        }
                        int count = 1;
                        if (args.length == 3) {
                            count = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                        }
                        if (!ItemDefinition.forId(id).isStackable()) {
                            if (count > player.getInventory().freeSlots()) {
                                count = player.getInventory().freeSlots();
                            }
                        }
                        
                        player.getInventory().add(player.checkForSkillcape(new Item(id, count)));
                    } else {
                        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Syntax is ::item [id] [count].");
                    }

Read full topic
